titles.title: Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
To amend title 18, United States Code, to criminalize the knowing consent of the visual depiction, or live transmission, of a minor engaged in sexually explicit conduct, and for other purposes.
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 115-137.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 86.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 352 Reported to House. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate on H.R. 1973 and H.R. 1761. The resolution provides for proceedings during the period from May 26, 2017 through June 5, 2017.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 352.
The resolution provides for one hour of general debate on H.R. 1973 and H.R. 1761. The resolution provides for proceedings during the period from May 26, 2017 through June 5, 2017.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 1761.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 352, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jackson Lee amendment No. 1.

vote.text: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 368 - 51 (Roll no. 284).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

committee.subcommittee: Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary:
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
This bill amends the federal criminal code to revise provisions that prohibit the sexual exploitation of children for the production of child pornography.
